content.question: The graph shows the vertical position as a function of time for an object launched from the ground. Which of the following graphs correctly shows the vertical position of the object as a function of time if the object was launched at the same angle but with twice the initial speed?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 through 5, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Position, in meters,” and the numbers 0 through 70, in increments of 10, are indicated. The curve is in the shape of a parabola. It begins at the point with coordinates 0 comma 0, and moves upward and to the right. It passes through the points with coordinates 1 comma 40, and 2 comma 60, and it reaches a maximum at the point with approximate coordinates 2.5 comma 63. It then moves downward and to the right, and passes through the points with coordinates 3 comma 60, and 4 comma 40. It continues downward until it ends on the horizontal axis at the point with coordinates 5 comma 0.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 through 5, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Position, in meters,” and the numbers 0 through 140, in increments of 20, are indicated. The curve is in the shape of a parabola. It begins at the point with coordinates 0 comma 0, and moves upward and to the right. It passes through the points with coordinates 1 comma 80, and 2 comma 120, and it reaches a maximum at the point with approximate coordinates 2.5 comma 125. It then moves downward and to the right, and passes through the points with coordinates 3 comma 120, and 4 comma 80. It continues downward until it ends on the horizontal axis at the point with coordinates 5 comma 0.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 through 10, in increments of 2, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Position, in meters,” and the numbers 0 through 70, in increments of 10, are indicated. The curve is in the shape of a parabola. It begins at the point with coordinates 0 comma 0, and moves upward and to the right. It passes through the points with coordinates 2 comma 40, and 4 comma 60, and it reaches a maximum at the point with approximate coordinates 5 comma 63. It then moves downward and to the right, and passes through the points with coordinates 6 comma 60, and 8 comma 40. It continues downward until it ends on the horizontal axis at the point with coordinates 10 comma 0.

topic.text: 1.5: Vectors and Motion in Two Dimensions

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
